description: From Latin crucifer (“cross-bearer”), from crux (“cross”) + ferō (“I carry, bear”).

entries.meaning: (Christianity) A person who carries a cross in a religious procession, a cross bearer.
(botany) A member of the family Cruciferae, the cabbage family, including cabbage and mustard.
examples: Note: Brassicaceae may be used as an alternative and equivalent name for this family.
